newsitem.title: INDIA: Bus, acid-carrying tanker collide in India, 6 dead.
newsitem.headline: Bus, acid-carrying tanker collide in India, 6 dead.

text.p: A bus and a tanker carrying acid collided head-on in northern India on Wednesday, killing six people and injuring 53, United News of India (UNI) said.
The news agency said the acid blinded 25 people, and four people were critically injured.
The crash, near Kharar town in the northern state of Punjab, occurred after the bus's brakes failed and the driver lost control of the vehicle, UNI said.
The news agency did not say how many people were in the bus.
